channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report E-2024030584
item.description:
Report E-2024030584

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: BRANDON
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 20, 2024, one (1) 2.5-gallon jug of UN1791 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged jug, all UN1791 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.
